doctor.job_description: Anesthesiologists administer anesthetics and monitor patients during surgical procedures to ensure safety and comfort. They develop anesthetic plans based on patient health status, manage pain control, maintain vital functions during surgery, handle emergency situations, and oversee post-operative recovery. They may specialize in areas like pediatric anesthesia, cardiac anesthesia, obstetric anesthesia, or pain management.

doctor.salary_range: $350,000 - $550,000 annually, depending on practice setting and location

doctor.job_description: Radiologists interpret medical images such as X-rays, CT scans, MRIs, ultrasounds, and nuclear medicine studies to diagnose and treat diseases. They perform image-guided procedures like biopsies and fluid drainages, consult with other physicians about findings, and may specialize in areas like neuroradiology, interventional radiology, or musculoskeletal imaging. They play a crucial role in disease detection and treatment planning.
doctor.eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of a diagnostic radiology residency (5 years, including internship year), board certification through the American Board of Radiology (ABR) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Diagnostic radiology residency (5 years, including internship)
Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in subspecialty areas
related_exams: American Board of Radiology Core and Certifying Exams
doctor.salary_range: $350,000 - $500,000 annually, with interventional radiologists often earning more

doctor.job_description: Emergency medicine physicians provide immediate recognition, evaluation, care, and stabilization for patients with acute illnesses and injuries in emergency department settings. They manage a wide spectrum of conditions from minor injuries to life-threatening emergencies, perform procedures like intubation and central line placement, coordinate care with specialists, and make rapid disposition decisions.
doctor.eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of an emergency medicine residency (3-4 years), board certification through the American Board of Emergency Medicine (ABEM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in critical care, toxicology, sports medicine, etc.
related_exams: American Board of Emergency Medicine Written and Oral Certification Exams
doctor.salary_range: $300,000 - $400,000 annually, often with shift-based compensation models

doctor.job_description: Pediatric subspecialists focus on diagnosing and treating specific health conditions in infants, children, and adolescents. These may include pediatric cardiologists, neurologists, endocrinologists, gastroenterologists, hematologist-oncologists, pulmonologists, and others. They manage complex and rare childhood diseases requiring specialized expertise and often work in children's hospitals or academic medical centers.

doctor.salary_range: $240,000 - $400,000+ annually, varying widely by subspecialty and location

doctor.job_description: Neurosurgeons diagnose and surgically treat disorders of the central and peripheral nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, and nerves. They perform surgeries for conditions such as brain tumors, spine disorders, traumatic brain injuries, vascular anomalies, epilepsy, and congenital abnormalities. They use highly specialized techniques including microsurgery, endoscopy, and stereotactic surgery.
doctor.eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of neurological surgery residency (7 years), board certification through the American Board of Neurological Surgery (ABNS) or equivalent, and state medical license.

Decision-making with narrow margins of error

doctor.job_description: Pathologists study the causes and effects of diseases by examining body tissues, fluids, and organs. They analyze biopsies, surgical specimens, and autopsy findings to provide diagnoses. They interpret laboratory tests, guide treatment decisions, consult with other physicians, and may specialize in areas like anatomic pathology, clinical pathology, forensic pathology, or specific organ systems. They play a crucial role in cancer diagnosis and classification.
doctor.eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of pathology residency (3-4 years), board certification through the American Board of Pathology (ABP) or equivalent, and state medical license.

doctor.salary_range: $250,000 - $400,000 annually, varying by subspecialty and practice setting

doctor.job_description: Urologists diagnose and treat disorders of the urinary tract in both men and women, and the reproductive system in men. They manage conditions such as urinary tract infections, kidney stones, prostate diseases, male infertility, erectile dysfunction, and urologic cancers. They perform surgeries including prostatectomies, kidney surgeries, and bladder procedures, and increasingly use minimally invasive and robotic techniques.

doctor.job_description: Ophthalmologists are medical doctors who specialize in eye and vision care. They diagnose and treat eye diseases, perform eye surgeries, prescribe medications, and fit eyeglasses and contact lenses. They manage conditions such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy, and perform procedures like LASIK, corneal transplants, and retinal surgeries.

doctor.salary_range: $300,000 - $500,000+ annually, with higher earnings for surgical subspecialists

doctor.job_description: Gastroenterologists diagnose and treat disorders of the digestive system, including the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestines, pancreas, gallbladder, and liver. They perform procedures such as endoscopies, colonoscopies, and ERCP. They manage conditions like inflammatory bowel disease, liver disease, reflux, peptic ulcers, and gastrointestinal cancers.

doctor.job_description: Pulmonologists diagnose and treat diseases of the respiratory system, including the lungs, upper airways, thoracic cavity, and chest wall. doctor.salary_range: $300,000 - $400,000 annually, with critical care certified physicians often earning more

doctor.job_description: Rheumatologists diagnose and treat autoimmune diseases and disorders of the joints, muscles, and bones. doctor.job_description: Endocrinologists diagnose and treat disorders related to hormones and the endocrine system. doctor.job_description: Nephrologists specialize in kidney care and treating diseases of the kidneys.
